item.title: Poker Robot
item.description: TL; DR Researching and applying the Reinforcement Learning approach to no-limit Texas poker. Fragment of one of the experiments. My role Application of existing models Implementation of the pipeline of experiments and comparison of models Development of architectural features of the poker environment experiments Experiments

We managed to create a quality MVP. NDA. Yandex Direct img. My team Me. Olga â€“ MEPhI graduate, postgraduate student of the Institute of Theoretical and Experimental Physics (ITEP) in elementary particle physics, machine learning specialist, programmer.. My role Searching for a client Management Programming (python) Environment Reinforcement Learning Simulator … Statistical analysis of approaches, selection and analysis of metrics

item.title: ML-IDS
item.description: – The project is in progress. – TL; DR Machine Intelligence, interdisciplinary perspective.

item.title: Anomaly Prediction
item.description: TL; DR Application of Neural Networks, Machine Learning algorithms, Reinforcement Learning and Natural Language Processing for Detection / Prediction of Anomalies in Storage Area Network by log data. Also, development and testing researched methods for improving Digital Twin of Storage Area Network, methods on chaotic systems, OpenAI Gym wrappers. Research Article “Online detection of failures generated by storage simulator” (2021) Research Article “SANgo: a storage infrastructure simulator with reinforcement learning support” (2020) Experiments and intermediate results Photo by Denny MÃ¼ller on Unsplash

item.title: Satellite Positioning
item.description: The project task â€“ build a model that would predict the position of space objects using simulation data. https://www.esa.int/Applications/Telecommunications_Integrated_Applications/Orbits About Predicting the position of satellites is one of the most important tasks in astronomy. For example, information on the exact position of satellites in orbit is necessary to avoid extremely dangerous satellite collisions. Each collision leads not only to satellites destruction, but also to occurrence of thousands of pieces of space debris pieces.

item.title: Space Navigator
item.description: TL; DR We made Space Navigator - a system for automatically determining the probability of collision of space objects and calculating the most effective evasive maneuver using AI. Stage of the project: Research Article “Space Navigator: a Tool for the Optimization of Collision Avoidance Maneuvers” (2020) MVP (2019) First place in the competition of projects of the Academy of Roscosmos (presentation slides, 2018) VR presentation (2018) Demonstrations and reports:

item.title: Computer Vision course â€“ OTUS
item.description: Photo by Runze Shi on Unsplash I took a course on Ð¡omputer Vision from OTUS (in Russian) from April 28 to September 25, 2020. The course was practical and covered Neural Networks and Deep Learning in the field of Computer Vision - from the basics to the latest frameworks and state-of-the-art scientific articles. Besides that, there were cool lessons about TensorRT and Server Inference. In addition, the interesting thing about this course was to learn from the experience of colleagues who use Computer Vision in different fields.

item.title: SMILES â€“ The Summer School of Machine Learning at Skoltech
item.description: Participated in the international summer school SMILES â€“ The Summer School of Machine Learning at Skoltech from 16 to 21 August 2020. In the poster session, I talked about two “AI & Satellite Problems” projects that we were engaged at the Laboratory of Methods for Big Data Analysis at the National Research University Higher School of Economics. Below is the submitted poster and the certificate provide. Poster PDF Certificate PDF Post about Data Analysis for Satellite Tracking
